{"step_by_step_thinking": "The most common bone tumor that occurs in children is usually osteosarcoma. Osteosarcoma is a malignant bone tumor that primarily affects children and adolescents. It commonly occurs in the long bones, such as the femur or tibia. Ewing's sarcoma is another type of bone tumor that can occur in children, but it is less common than osteosarcoma. Metastatic carcinoma and multiple myeloma are not typically seen as the most common bone tumors in children.", "answer_choice": "A"}
